adqlParser.query
Class ADQLQuery

java.lang.Object
  adqlParser.query.ADQLQuery
All Implemented Interfaces:
ADQLObject
Direct Known Subclasses:
SaadaADQLQuery
public class ADQLQuery
extends java.lang.Object
implements ADQLObject

Object representation of an ADQL query or sub-query.
The resulting object of the AdqlParser is an object of this class.

Version:
06/2010
Author:
Grégory Mantelet (CDS)

          Distinct values for the first selected column ?

Gets the selected columns.

Returns:
An iterator on selected columns.

getColumn

public ADQLOperand getColumn(int indCol)
Gets the specified selected column.

Parameters:
indCol - Index of the wanted column.
Returns:
The selected column whose the index is given or null if the index is incorrect.

getNbColumns

public int getNbColumns()
Gets the number of selected columns.

Returns:
The number of selected columns.

addSelectColumn

public void addSelectColumn(ADQLOperand col)
                     throws ParseException
Adds the given operand as a selected column of this query.

Parameters:
col - The operand to add as a selected column.
Throws:
ParseException - If col is null or if there is already a column with the same alias than the one of col.

removeSelectColumn

public ADQLOperand removeSelectColumn(int indCol)
Removes the specified column selected in this query.

Parameters:
indCol - The index of the column to remove (from 1).
Returns:
The removed column or null if the given index is incorrect.

removeSelectColumn

public ADQLOperand removeSelectColumn(java.lang.String colAlias)
Removes the specified column selected in this query.

Parameters:
colAlias - The alias of the column to remove.
Returns:
The removed column or null if not found.

Returns:
An iterator on the selected tables.

getNbTables

public int getNbTables()
Gets the number of selected tables.

Returns:
The number of selected tables (tables of the clause FROM).

addTable

public void addTable(ADQLTable table)
              throws ParseException
Adds the given table as a selected table of this query.

Parameters:
table - The table to add.
Throws:
ParseException - If table is null or if it doesn't have a name or if it is a sub-query without an alias.

Removes the specified table selected in this query.

Parameters:

Returns:
The removed table or null if the given index is incorrect.

The removed table or null if not found.

getConstraint

public ADQLConstraint getConstraint()
Gets the first line constraint.
Note: to access the next constraints use the ADQLConstraint.next() function.

Returns:
The first constraint of the line constraints of this query.

addConstraint

public void addConstraint(ADQLConstraint cons)
Adds the given constraint to the list of line constraints (constraints of the clause WHERE) with an AND keyword if there is already another line constraint.

Parameters:
cons - The constraint to add.
See Also:
addConstraint(ADQLConstraint, boolean)

addConstraint

public void addConstraint(ADQLConstraint cons,
                          boolean or)
Adds the given constraint to the list of line constraints (constraints of the clause WHERE) with the specified keyword (AND or OR) if there is already another line constraint.

Parameters:
cons - The constraint to add.
or - true to concatenate the current list of line constraints and the given constraint with an OR keyword, false to concatenate with an AND keyword.

clearConstraints

public ADQLConstraint clearConstraints()
Clears all line constraints of this query.
Note: to remove a specific constraint use the ADQLConstraint.removeNext() function on the parent of the constraint to remove.

Returns:
The removed constraint.

hasDistinct

public boolean hasDistinct()
Indicates whether distinct values are wanted for the first selected column of this query.

Returns:
true means there is a DISTINCT keyword, false else.

setDistinct

public void setDistinct(boolean distinctValues)
Lets you indicate whether the values of the first selected column must be distinct.

Parameters:
distinctValues - true means this query must have a distinct values for the 1st selected column, false else.

getGroupByList

public java.util.Iterator<ColumnReference> getGroupByList()
Gets the list of columns to use to group the results of the execution of this query.

Returns:
An iterator on the columns of the clause GROUP BY.

addGroupBy

public void addGroupBy(ColumnReference colRef)
Adds a grouped column to this query.

Parameters:
colRef - The column to add as a GROUP BY item.

removeGroupBy

public ColumnReference removeGroupBy(int ind)
Removes the specified GROUP BY item.

Parameters:
ind - The index of the item to remove (from 1).
Returns:
The removed column reference.

getHaving

public ADQLConstraint getHaving()
Gets the first constraint of the group constraint of this query. Note: to access the next constraints use the ADQLConstraint.next() function.

Returns:
The first group constraint of this query.

addHaving

public void addHaving(ADQLConstraint condition)
Adds a group constraint to this query (constraint of the clause HAVING) with an AND keyword if there is already another group constraint.

Parameters:
condition - The constraint to add.
See Also:
addHaving(ADQLConstraint, boolean)

addHaving

public void addHaving(ADQLConstraint condition,
                      boolean or)
Adds a group constraint to this query (constraints of the clause HAVING) with the specified keyword (AND or OR) if there is already another group constraint.

Parameters:
condition - The constraint to add.
or - true to concatenate the current list of group constraints and the given constraint with an OR keyword, false to concatenate with an AND keyword.

clearHaving

public ADQLConstraint clearHaving()
Clears all group constraints of this query.
Note: to remove a specific constraint use the ADQLConstraint.removeNext() function on the parent of the constraint to remove.

Returns:
The removed constraint.

public java.lang.String toSQL(boolean end)
                       throws ParseException

Parameters:
end - true to end the SQL query by a semicolon, false else.
Returns:
The corresponding SQL query.

ParseException - If there is any error during the translation.

getAll

public java.util.Vector<ADQLObject> getAll(SearchHandler searchCondition)
Description copied from interface: ADQLObject
Searches for all ADQL objects which satisfy the condition implemented in the given SearchHandler instance.

Specified by:
getAll in interface ADQLObject
Parameters:
searchCondition - The search condition that wanted ADQL objects must satisfy.
Returns:
All matched ADQL objects or if there is no matched objects returns null or an empty vector.

getFirst

public ADQLObject getFirst(SearchHandler searchCondition)
Description copied from interface: ADQLObject
Searches for ADQL objects which satisfy the condition implemented in the given SearchHandler instance.
ONLY THE FIRST ADQL OBJECT WHICH HAS MATCHED IS RETURNED !

Specified by:
getFirst in interface ADQLObject
Parameters:
searchCondition - The search condition that the wanted ADQL object must satisfy.
Returns:
The first ADQL object which has matched.

remove

public ADQLObject remove(SearchHandler searchCondition)
                  throws ParseException
Description copied from interface: ADQLObject
Removes the first ADQL object which has matched.

Specified by:
remove in interface ADQLObject
Parameters:
searchCondition - The search condition that the ADQL object to remove must satisfy.
Returns:
The removed ADQL object or null if no object has been found or removed.
Throws:
ParseException - If there is any error during the deletion.

replaceBy

public ADQLObject replaceBy(SearchHandler searchCondition,
                            ADQLObject replacementObject)
                     throws ParseException
Description copied from interface: ADQLObject
Replaces the first ADQL object which has matched by the given ADQL object.

Specified by:
replaceBy in interface ADQLObject
Parameters:
searchCondition - The search condition that the ADQL object to replace must satisfy.
replacementObject - The ADQL object which must replace the first ADQL object which has matched.
Returns:
The replaced ADQL object or null if no object has been found or replaced.
Throws:
ParseException - If there is any error during the replacement.
